description: From Spanish octorón, compare quadroon from cuarterón (“quadroon”).

entries.meaning: (dated or historical, now offensive) Someone having one-eighth black ancestry.
examples: Grandmother Baxter was a quadroon or an octoroon, or in any case she was nearly white.

entries.meaning: (dated or historical, now offensive) Someone having 1/64th black ancestry: the child of a quintoon and a white man.
examples: Quintoon: child of mustiphini and white maleUnspeakable: child of mustiphini and white womanOctoroon: child of quintoon and white manUnspeakable: child of quintoon and white woman
